Name: Aparna Soneja
Biography: Aparna is a Software engineer at Accenture & an Open source advocate by passion. She not only loves to code but also creates technical content and share with her community. In short, Aparna is a developer, content creator, educator, Open source contributor and also a public speaker who loves to deliver talks at conferences.

Name: Daisy Leigh Brenecki
Biography: Daisy is a full-stack developer and full-snack devourer who hails from Tarntanya/Adelaide and is now based in Narrm/Melbourne. She was the Conference Director of PyCon AU 2023 and PyConline AU 2020, and is enthusiastic about well-designed APIs and dresses with pockets. She is more scared of you than you are of her.

Name: Cosima Meyer
Biography: Cosima Meyer works as a data scientist at IBM where she aims to make machine learning explainable. As an active member of PyLadies and R-Ladies and Google‘s Women Techmakers Ambassador, she strives to bring the two communities together and make the contributions of underrepresented backgrounds in tech more visible. During her PhD studies at the University of Mannheim, Cosima discovered her passion for sharing knowledge - both by writing technical blog posts and by developing open source software.

Name: Joanna Jablonski
Biography: I help developers learn because I like code, words, and people.

Name: Pri Boyano
Biography: Sou a Pri, Bióloga, estudante de Tecnologia da Informação, mãe de um menino e de vários gatos. Voluntária na organização da comunidade Pyladies Bioinfo BR, apaixonada por Dados e Biologia. Grande parte da minha vida profissional foi na pesquisa com Hemoglobinas e Anemia Falciforme, mas atualmente estou na Imuno-hematologia de Doadores de Sangue do Hemocentro da UNICAMP em Campinas-SP. Meu objetivo é unir a Tecnologia com minha vivência de Laboratório e Pesquisa, as Pyladies Bioinfo são o elo desses dois temas principais na minha vida.

Name: Mariatta
Biography: Mariatta is a Python core developer where she focuses on improving the workflow and documentation. She is active in the Python community as an advisor for the Global PyLadies, and PyCon US Chair.

Name: Valeria Cerpa Salas
Biography: Valeria Cerpa trabaja en el área de desarrollo de software y es arquitecta, actualmente es becaria de investigación en la organización Engineering for Change (E4C) y de la organización LAYCS. Recientemente fué seleccionada para asistir virtualmente a la GHC 23. En 2021, fundó "Datos para Espacios Resilientes", primer proyecto digital del Fellowship Resilience Fund, lo que le permitió liderar un equipo diverso y trabajar en la generación de mapas interactivos sobre seguridad urbana. Además, Valeria está involucrada en el desarrollo de "Planning 2050", un proyecto web peruano-americano, que promueve compromisos sostenibles para ciudades desde instituciones públicas. Anteriormente, fue becaria de US Green Building Council en Washington DC, Harvard WECode, fue asistente de investigación en la Universidad Católica de Santa María y participó en el podcast de Women Who Code (WWCode). Su experiencia le ha permitido colaborar con organizaciones de Estados Unidos, Alemania, Suiza, Francia y Perú.

Name: Ria Bhatia
Biography: Ria Bhatia is a driven and passionate software engineer at Goldman Sachs. Over the course of her career, she has worked with various database systems, prioritizing performance, data durability, and scalability. Her expertise extends from cloud-based relational databases to embedded persistent key-value stores. Ria is passionate about simplifying complex concepts, fostering team learning, and staying at the forefront of technology trends. She's an enthusiastic speaker, having previously presented at prestigious conferences like PyCascades and Women Tech Network. Committed to gender diversity in tech, Ria mentors aspiring engineers and has been recognized with the Google Women in Technology Scholarship and the Nutanix Women in Tech Scholarship for her leadership and community contributions. Beyond tech, Ria enjoys screen-free hobbies like reading and embroidery, showcasing her artistic talents. She's also adept at playing multiple instruments, demonstrating her musical talent and diverse interests.

Name: Jessie Newman
Biography: Jessie Newman is a software engineer with six years experience at Google working on Google Drive, Search, and Maps, and three years experience working in high frequency trading at Hudson River Trading. She was a founding co-lead of Hudson River Trading's womens employee resource group.

Name: April
Biography: Data scietist in pharmaceutical company

Name: Lidiane Monteiro
Biography: Founder of InspirAda na Computação, Software developer at LuizaLabs and Host of the podcast Cabeça de Lab. Passionate about people and knowledge, contributed to the co-founding of technology communities such as PyLadies Recife and Women Who Code Recife, participant of PyLadies Brasil, PUG- PE and Django Girls. Pernambucana, root supporter of Sport Club do Recife and Joana's aunt. I love beer and my dogs (Teddy - In Memorial and Bob). I proudly graduated in Computing at UFRPE and was a Computer Teacher for primary education and professional training.

Name: Lisa Marielle Cooper
Biography: Lisa Marielle Cooper (she/her) is an interdisciplinary artist, disability justice advocate, and community builder. She is a co-organizer of Pyjamas Conf, the laziest 24-hour Python conference in the world, and is one of the co-founders of PyLadies Calgary, Alberta's first Pyladies chapter.

Name: Bia Rosa
Biography: Backend and Infrastrucure Engineer at Lumos. Worked previously at Red Hat and Stone. Has led and managed teams before, and is now happy as an individual contributor. Works with Python for over 7 years and has been involved with the Python community since then, organized several Pyladies, PythOnRio meet up and is the conference chair of the Python Brasil 2024 in Rio.

Name: Swarooprani Manoor
Biography: Prof.Swarooprani Manoor is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Master of Computer Applications at KLS Gogte Institute of Technology, Karnataka India. She has over 18 years of teaching experience, and is proficient in Python Programming, Data science, Unix Shell Programming, and Blockchain Technology. She has conducted workshops on Python programming at various colleges and schools, and also conducted a workshop for school students under the banner of PyCon India 2023 (PyDiverse).  She is a passionate educator who is committed to helping students learn and grow. She is also a strong advocate for diversity and inclusion in STEM fields. In her spare time, Prof.Swarooprani Manoor, enjoys writing Technical Articles in Kannada language related to Computer Science domain and spending time with her family. She has won Quora Kannada Top Writer Award in the year 2021. She is also an avid reader and enjoys learning new things.  She graduated from college with a degree in Business Administration, and she then went on to earn a master's degree in Computer Applications. She is passionate about sharing her knowledge and expertise with others, and she is always looking for new ways to help people learn.

Name: Micaela Reyes
Biography: Micaela is a Software Engineer transitioning into Data Analysis. She is deeply involved in the Python community - serves as the Director of Operations for PythonPH and is a Python Software Foundation Fellow. She treasures meaningful friendships, draws inspiration from passionate individuals and finds great fulfillment in sharing knowledge.

Name: Pavithra Eswaramoorthy
Biography: Pavithra Eswaramoorthy is a Developer Advocate at Quansight, where she works to improve the developer experience and community engagement for several open source projects in the PyData community. Currently, she maintains the Bokeh visualization library, and contributes to the Nebari (adjacent to the Jupyter community) and conda-store (part of the conda ecosystem) projects. Pavithra has been involved in the open source community for over 5 years, notable as a maintainer of the Dask library and an administrator for Wikimedia’s OSS programs. In her spare time, she enjoys a good book and hot coffee. :)

Name: sireesha chavali
Biography: A passionate AI Engineer at Enique Solutions primarily focusing on the development of conversational AI solutions for a diverse range of clients. My technical expertise encompasses industry-leading platforms such as Google BigQuery, Microsoft Azure, and Power Apps. With a specialized skill set in natural language processing (NLP) and computer vision (CV), I consistently aim to deliver products that are at the intersection of innovation and user-centric design, all underpinned by the transformative capabilities of artificial intelligence. Outside of my primary professional role, I am deeply committed to advancing the representation and empowerment of women within the AI sector. In this capacity, I am honored to serve as a Volunteer Lead for Women in AI, an esteemed global community that brings together female AI practitioners, researchers, and enthusiasts. My responsibilities therein include the organization and facilitation of key events, the design and implementation of specialized workshops, and the establishment of mentorship programs—all with the overarching goal of fostering support and growth for women in the AI domain. My dedication to the field of AI is unwavering, characterized by a continuous pursuit of knowledge and skill enhancement.

Name: Judit Guimera Busquets
Biography: I'm an engineer by heart, graduated as an aeronautical engineer in 2007 at the Universitat Politecnica de Catalunya (Barcelona) and went to work as a quality engineer for pressure vessels at Bureau Veritas in the area of Barcelona. Later on, as I wanted to go back to the aviation sector, I went back to study and graduated with a BEng in Air Transportation from City, University of London in 2013. After graduating at City I did my PhD there focused on 'Developing Advanced Methods to Predict Air Traffic Network Growth'. During my PhD I learned about machine learning, data mining and data science and I've never looked back again. I worked for Virgin Atlantic as an analyst at its cargo and passenger side division; then I've moved to Royal Mail as a data scientist and I'm currently a principal data scientist at Datasparq, an AI & Data service provider which focuses on solving complex business challenges.

Name: Mariana Oliveira
Biography: Sou Mariana Oliveira! Graduanda em Engenharia da Complexidade na Universidade Católica de Pernambuco, faço parte do Pyladies Recife e apaixonada por Tecnologia e a Cultura Maker! Estou me especializando na área de Robótica/ IoT,  usando Python como linguagem base para o desenvolvimento de softwares e utilizando sistemas embarcados como Raspberry Pi e Arduino como base de desenvolvimento de novos hardwares. Estou aprimorando os conhecimentos em Python e Open CV, para desenvolver novos projetos com o foco de usar Visão Computacional em Sistemas Embarcados.

Name: Bilge Yücel
Biography: Bilge is a developer advocate at deepset, working with Haystack, an open source LLM framework. With over two years of experience as a Software Engineer, she developed a strong interest in NLP and pursued a master's degree in Artificial Intelligence at KU Leuven with a focus on NLP. Now, she enjoys working with Haystack, writing tutorials, and helping the community build NLP applications. ✨ 🥑

Name: Rossana Suarez
Biography: Ingeniera en Sistemas, Tech Lead DevOps, #AWSHero, #GitlabHero y #DockerCaptain Su experiencia como Mentor y Content Creator, así como su canal de YouTube 295devops

Name: HanaPoulpe
Biography: Hana (she/they), former dev at amazon (python, AWS, database, dev ops, you name it), back-end dev at Kraken Tech. Work mainly with python, likes to think of testing and making code predictible.

Name: Ana Dulce Padovan
Biography: Co-fundadora do PyLadies São Carlos, presidente da Associação Python Brasil, organizadora da Python Brasil e PSF Fellow member.

Name: Sarah Abderemane
Biography: Meet Sarah Abderemane, also known as sabderemane, a french backend developer with few years of experience. She works at Octopus Energy France to contribute to climate change. She organises the Django Paris meetup and is an active member of the Django community: member of the Django Accessibility team and maintainer of djangoproject.com.

Name: Winnie Ke
Biography: Winnie is the Chair of PyCon Taiwan 2023. She is working as a software engineer at Applied Materials. During my time as a student, I began my journey with Python and got involved in numerous side projects that allowed me to immerse myself in the vibrant Python community. My passion for contributing to this community started to flourish. In 2019, I joined the program committee, and in 2020, I proudly served as the program chair. In 2022, I led the development of an online conference via Gather Town. Now, I'm honored to be the Chairperson for PyCon Taiwan 2023, the first female and youngest Chairperson in its history. My journey with PyCon Taiwan has been exciting, and I'm eager to continue contributing to this vibrant community.

Name: Jessica Temporal
Biography: Jessica Temporal is a Sr. Developer Advocate at Auth0 by Okta. Co-founder and co-host of the first Brazilian podcast about data science Pizza de Dados. GitHub Star, author of "The Big Git Microbook" and creator of GitFichas, collection of Git study cards. Also loves to knit and picking up new skills on YouTube, right now learning to play the keyboard and how to do digital drawings.

Name: Marina Moro López
Biography: Ingeniera biomédica y futura doctora en biomedicina formada en España. Apasionada del mundo bio y de la programación. Uso Python para facilitarme la vida en mi carrera científica :)

Name: Cecilia Tivir
Biography: Cecilia é Co-Fundadora da PyLadies Maputo e da Wansati Lab. Actualmente estudante e pesquisadora (main field: AI and Education). Também, professora, mentora e organizadora de eventos sobre Tech e ama a natureza.

Name: Maaya Ishida
Biography: I have organized PyLadies Tokyo since 2014. And I'm one of the staffs the PyLadies Caravan project supported by PyCon JP Association which means road show at outside Tokyo.  After graduate for University(my subject is Philosophy!) I started career at Test Engineer in quality management team.  After a few years, I changed role the Test Engineer to System Engineer at small company which has developed Recommendation and Analysis Models. I was interested in cloud architect, so I became a Cloud Solution Architect for AWS, OCI and Azure at next company. At this time, I was awarded the Microsoft MVP for Azure, so I become Microsoft Japan employee now. Current occupation is pre-sales architect especially　 　Azure PaaS and Development tools (include GitHub family).

Name: Denny Perez
Biography: English teacher for living and Python community member for I'm a believer in the transformative power it has on people. Came for the language as I was learning programming with Python and stayed for the community that changed my life forever. Master in Innovation with Education Technologies and Bachelor in IT, I'm one of the co-founder of PyLadies Brazil, the biggest network of PyLadies chapters in the world, and PyLadies Natal (my local chapter). I'm in the organization team of Python Nordeste, a regional Python conference in Brazil and as a broader work in the Python Community I serve as the vice president of the Python Software Foundation board of directors.

Name: Ryllari Costa
Biography: A proud Brazilian from the Northeast region. Software Engineer, bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering at Federal Institute of Education, Science and Technology of Ceará (IFCE) and master's student in Computer Science at the Federal Rural University of Semi-Arid (UFERSA) and State University of Rio Grande do Norte (UERN), where I am developing research in artificial intelligence applied to data collection. Member of PyLadies Brazil, where I was co-organizer of the PyLadies Fortaleza chapter between 2017 and 2020. Big Kahuna of the online edition of the Python Nordeste conference (2020/2021). Member of the Python Brazil community since 2017, I have worked locally in the Python User Groups of the states of Ceará (2017-2020) and Rio Grande do Norte (2021-present). I am an enthusiast of supporting and encouraging the growth of women in tech.

Name: Mona Obedoza
Biography: Mona Obedoza is a high schooler, tech enthusiast, and aspiring AI engineer, as well as a student ambassador for Women in AI Philippines and a co-leader of the Girls Can Code club in her school. She has participated and placed in numerous local and global tech competitions, and also hosts coding workshops and hackathons for students to further her mission of helping kids discover the many possibilities of how technology and AI can positively shape our world. In her free time, she enjoys watching anime, reading manga and fantasy novels, and baking cookies. You can learn more about her at sunshinebunnysoftware.tech.

Name: Débora Azevedo (HOST)
Biography: English teacher for living and Python community member for I'm a believer in the transformative power it has on people. Came for the language as I was learning programming with Python and stayed for the community that changed my life forever. Master in Innovation with Education Technologies and Bachelor in IT, I'm one of the co-founder of PyLadies Brazil, the biggest network of PyLadies chapters in the world, and PyLadies Natal (my local chapter). I'm in the organization team of Python Nordeste, a regional Python conference in Brazil and as a broader work in the Python Community I serve as the vice president of the Python Software Foundation board of directors.

Name: Mariana Bocoi
Biography: Mariana is part of the PyLadies Stockholm community and works as a DevOps/Infrastructure engineer. Before digging deeper into the clouds, she worked with backend development for over ten years. She is passionate about helping others and fostering belonging. Outside work, Mariana has a hobby of making hobbies, currently rediscovering vintage audio cassettes.
